text: this is David Kirkpatrick reporting from
Tripoli Libya we're here at the Rixos
Hotel where the Foreign Minister just
gave a remarkable press conference with
his hands visibly shaking he read a
prepared statement that seemed to roll
back a lot of the bellicose rhetoric
we've seen in the last couple of days
from Colonel Qaddafi and a son Saif
al-islam L Qaddafi about about storming
the bastions the rebels in the east
welcome to Lachlan fo de lis applause no
Wally jamia anomaly at Las curry he said
that they have in deference to the UN
resolution they have now imposed a
ceasefire and halted military operations
we're still trying to find out whether
that is true he didn't say whether or
not they're going to do anything to
alleviate the siege of the city of
Misrata the most important commercial
center here in the west of the country
it's held by rebels and the Qadhafi
comin has cut off water electricity and
telecommunications according to the
residence
